DataElement.preferredName: Disease Progression Free Last Verification Less First Pathologic Diagnosis Date Calculation Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of days from the date the patient was diagnosed with the disease to the date the patient was last verified to be free of progression.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Negation Disease Progression Last Verification Subtraction First Pathologic Diagnosis Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._The worsening of a disease over time._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._Support or establish by evidence or proof._The act of removing a part from the whole._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Negation Disease Progression Last Verification Subtraction First Pathologic Diagnosis Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:The worsening of a disease over time.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:Support or establish by evidence or proof.:The act of removing a part from the whole.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
Support or establish by evidence or proof.
The act of removing a part from the whole.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TCGA collection of Exceptional Responders data per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 6/23/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of Days from Date of I
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of Days from Date of Initial Diagnosis to Date Patient Last Verified Progression Free

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for TCGA collection of Exceptional Responders data per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 6/23/15 Added Alternate Name for TCGA XML DW 03-26-2019
